net.metro.analyze

Class SystemMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.JMapViewer
              • net.metro.analyze.SystemMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, MarkerListener, org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.interfaces.TileLoaderListener

    public class SystemMap
extends org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.JMapViewer
implements MarkerListener
    The hub for everything map-related in MASS. It is the component placed within MapFrames which paints a map with RoutePaths, Services, and corresponding data. It extends the JMapViewer class to add functionality such as highlighting points and coloring route paths according to numerical values.
    Author:
    Sean Harger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      void markerMoved(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
      If a marker is moved by the user, then the highlighted map marker is set to the marker that is moving, and marker movement is set to false.
      void markerMoving(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
      If a marker is currently moving, then marker movement is set to true and the current mouse position is set according to the location passed by the MarkerEvent.
      void markerNotSelected()
      If a point on the map is selected that does not contain a marker, then the highlighted map marker is reset to null and the status bar message is set to the default MapFrame.EMPTY_MESSAGE.
      void markerSelected(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
      If a marker is selected by the user, then that maker is set as the highlighted map marker.
      void mouseHoveringOverMarker(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
      If the user's mouse is currently hovering over a map marker, then the status bar is set to display information about that marker.
      void mouseHoveringOverNothing()
      If the user's mouse is currently not hovering over any marker, then the status bar is set to display the message SystemMap.EMPTY_MESSAGE.

    • Method Detail

      • setUpColorScale

        public void setUpColorScale()
        Sets up color scale for representation of data. Default color scale is red for maximum and green for minimum.

      • getMapFrame

        protected MapFrame getMapFrame()
        Returns the MapFrame to which this SystemMap belongs.
        Returns:
        the MapFrame to which this SystemMap belongs.

      • getScaleMin

        protected int getScaleMin()
        Returns the color scale minimum numerical value. If the scale is not fixed, then this method finds the relative minimum value according to the currently selected services and returns it; if the scale is fixed, then it returns the overridden scale minimum specified from the DataControlPalette.
        Returns:
        the current color scale minimum value.

      • getScaleMax

        protected int getScaleMax()
        Returns the color scale maximum numerical value. If the scale is not fixed, then this method finds the relative maximum value according to the currently selected services and returns it; if the scale is fixed, then it returns the overridden scale maximum specified from the DataControlPalette.
        Returns:
        the current color scale maximum value.

      • setScaleFixed

        protected void setScaleFixed(boolean fixed)
        Sets the color scale to fixed. This means that the data coloring will remain static and will not update when new services are added or the period changes.
        Parameters:
        fixed - true to enable fixed scale

      • overrideScaleMin

        protected void overrideScaleMin(int min)
        Overrides the minimum scale value with the specified integer.
        Parameters:
        integer - value desired to be set as the fixed minimum value.

      • getSelectedServices

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Service> getSelectedServices()
        Returns the selected services on the map. These are services that matched the RoutePath and Service constraints specified in the DataControlPalette and are available to display data on the map.
        Returns:
        the selected services on the map.

      • setViewableRoutes

        protected void setViewableRoutes(java.util.ArrayList<Route> rtes)
        Sets the viewable routes to the list of specified routes. Any routes not passed to the SystemMap via this method will NOT be available for data viewing.
        Parameters:
        rtes - list of Routes to be made available to the user for data viewing

      • setBackgroundRoutesVisible

        protected void setBackgroundRoutesVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of the background routes and stops. Normally, background routes and stops are painted gray, but they can become intrusive during data interpretation.
        Parameters:
        visible - true to set the background routes visible

      • setSelectedServices

      • setSelectedRoutePaths

        protected void setSelectedRoutePaths(java.util.ArrayList<RoutePath> rtePths)
        Sets the selected RoutePath objects to be painted on the map. Since RoutePaths are not associated with data, only a single color will be painted showing the path of the routes. This is typically used by the LineEditor for editing a route path.
        Parameters:
        rtePths - list of RoutePath objects to select

      • setSelectedRoutePath

        protected void setSelectedRoutePath(RoutePath rtePth)
        Sets the selected RoutePath object to be painted on the map. Since RoutePaths are not associated with data, only a single color will be painted showing the path of this route. This is typically used by the LineEditor for editing a route path.
        Parameters:
        rtePths - RoutePath object to select

      • clearSelectedRoutePaths

        protected void clearSelectedRoutePaths()
        Clears the selected RoutePath objects list.

      • findServiceStop

        private ServiceStop findServiceStop(Stop st)
        Finds a corresponding ServiceStop for the specified Stop. Since ServiceStops are data objects while Stops are route objects, a method is needed to bridge the gap between the two.
        Parameters:
        st - Stop to look for corresponding ServiceStop
        Returns:
        corresponding ServiceStop to the specified Stop or null if none was found.

      • isStopWithData

        private boolean isStopWithData(Stop stop)
        Determines whether a specified stop has data to be viewed. This information is cached when stops are painted on the map.
        Parameters:
        stop - Stop to inquire about data presence
        Returns:
        true if data exists for the specified stop

      • interpolateColor

        private java.awt.Color interpolateColor(int val,
                              int minVal,
                              int maxVal)
        Determines a color value to represent a data value. Using the minimum and maximum scale data values, this method computes the relative location of the specified data value in the color range and returns that color.
        Parameters:
        val - integer value to find a color to represent
        minVal - minimum scale value
        maxVal - maximum scale value
        Returns:
        Color representing the passed data value.

      • preparePointColors

        private java.awt.Color[] preparePointColors(java.util.List<ServiceStop> svcStops,
                                  DataType dType,
                                  int minVal,
                                  int maxVal)
        Prepares an array of colors for a series of ServiceStops. This is intended for "point style" data, colors that are intended to be local to a stop or waypoint.
        Parameters:
        svcStops - list of ServieStops to prepare color representations for
        dType - data type to extract from the ServiceStops
        minVal - minimum scale value
        maxVal - maximum scale value
        Returns:
        array of Color values representing the list of ServiceStops.

      • prepareConnectingLineColors

        private java.awt.Color[] prepareConnectingLineColors(java.util.List<ServiceStop> svcStops,
                                           java.util.List<WayPoint> wpts,
                                           DataType dType,
                                           int minVal,
                                           int maxVal)
        Prepares an array of colors for a series of ServiceStops. This method is intended for "segment style" data that is to be painted between stops and waypoints.
        Parameters:
        svcStops - list of ServieStops to prepare color representations for
        wpts - list of WayPoints in between the list of ServiceStops
        dType - data type to extract from the ServiceStops
        minVal - minimum scale value
        maxVal - maximum scale value
        Returns:
        array of Color values representing the list of ServiceStops.

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the map onto this component. The process is broken into several steps:
        1. the default implementation from the JMapViewer class is run to draw the background map
        2. the background route paths are painted using the method paintBackgroundRoutePaths()
        3. the selected route paths are painted using the method paintSelectedRoutePaths()
        4. the selected services are painted using the method paintSelectedServices
        5. the highlighted map marker is painted using the method paintHighlightedMapMarker()
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class org.openstreetmap.gui.jmapviewer.JMapViewer
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics variable

      • paintBackgroundRoutePaths

        private void paintBackgroundRoutePaths(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the background RoutePaths onto the map.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics variable

      • paintSelectedRoutePaths

        private void paintSelectedRoutePaths(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the selected RoutePaths onto the map in a more prominent color than the background RoutePaths.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics variable

      • paintSelectedServices

        private void paintSelectedServices(java.awt.Graphics g,
                         DataType dType)
        Paints the selected Services on the map. Since services contain data objects, this method prepares the color values for each service's path and then paints the corresponding colors onto the map. If the currently selected data type is a "point" style data type DataType.POINT, then data colors are painted on top of stops. If the currently selected data type is a "segment" style data type DataType.SEGMENT, then data colors are painted on top of and in between stop markers.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics variable
        dType - DataType to interpret and paint colors according to

      • paintConnectingLines

        private void paintConnectingLines(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        java.util.ArrayList<WayPoint> wayPoints,
                        int lnWidth,
                        java.awt.Color[] colors)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Paints a route path according to a series of WayPoints and a corresponding array of colors.
        Parameters:

        wayPoints - series of WayPoints indicating the path of the route
        lnWidth - width of the connecting lines
        colors - array of Color values to paint the corresponding stops in the WayPoint list
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • paintHighlightedMarker

        private void paintHighlightedMarker(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the highlighted marker on the map. A highlighted maker takes the same color as the marker dot that was painted originally on the map (with the exception of WayPoints which are normally invisible). If the marker is a Stop, then a bubble is also painted containing information about the stop's name, route path, and data values.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics variable

      • getLongestStringLengh

        private int getLongestStringLengh(java.awt.FontMetrics metrics,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> strings)
        Determines the longest String length (in pixels) from the specified array of Strings.
        Parameters:
        metrics - FontMetrics variable for the font to be used to paint the Strings
        strings - Strings from which to find the longest one
        Returns:
        the length of the longest String (in pixels).

      • markerSelected

        public void markerSelected(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
        If a marker is selected by the user, then that maker is set as the highlighted map marker. It also sets the status bar message to information about the selected marker.
        Specified by:
        markerSelected in interface MarkerListener
        Parameters:
        e - MarkerEvent object indicating the selected marker.

      • markerNotSelected

        public void markerNotSelected()
        If a point on the map is selected that does not contain a marker, then the highlighted map marker is reset to null and the status bar message is set to the default MapFrame.EMPTY_MESSAGE.
        Specified by:
        markerNotSelected in interface MarkerListener

      • markerMoved

        public void markerMoved(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
        If a marker is moved by the user, then the highlighted map marker is set to the marker that is moving, and marker movement is set to false.
        Specified by:
        markerMoved in interface MarkerListener
        Parameters:
        e - MarkerEvent object indicating the marker moved and the location moved to.

      • markerMoving

        public void markerMoving(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)
        If a marker is currently moving, then marker movement is set to true and the current mouse position is set according to the location passed by the MarkerEvent.
        Specified by:
        markerMoving in interface MarkerListener
        Parameters:
        e - MarkerEvent object indicating the marker moving and the current position of the user's mouse.

      • mouseHoveringOverMarker

        public void mouseHoveringOverMarker(MarkerListener.MarkerEvent e)

        Specified by:
        mouseHoveringOverMarker in interface MarkerListener
        Parameters:
        e - MarkerEvent object indicating the hovering marker.

      • mouseHoveringOverNothing

        public void mouseHoveringOverNothing()
        If the user's mouse is currently not hovering over any marker, then the status bar is set to display the message SystemMap.EMPTY_MESSAGE.
        Specified by:
        mouseHoveringOverNothing in interface MarkerListener
